snippet: Xenoceratops foremostensis flourished 80 million years ago, making it the oldest known large-bodied horned dinosaur to be found in Canada.
abstract: Study in The Canadian Journal of Earth Sciences reports discovery of Xenoceratops foremostensis, horned dinosaur that flourished in Canada 80 million years ago, 15 million years earlier than similar-looking Triceratops.
lead_paragraph: Xenoceratops foremostensis flourished 80 million years ago, making it the oldest known large-bodied horned dinosaur to be found in Canada.

headline.print_headline: Before Triceratops, There Was This Prickly Fellow
headline.seo: Xenoceratops, New Type of Horned Dinosaur, Is Identified in Canada
headline.main: Before Triceratops, There Was This Prickly Fellow
